message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG

Reasoning: 
1. cs.GT (Game Theory): The paper studies a cooperative card game from a game theory viewpoint, and analyzes its complexity.
2. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper discusses a mathematical model of a single-player version of the game, which could be of interest to AI researchers working on game-playing agents.
3. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper analyzes the complexity of the game and shows that it is intractable in a general setting, but becomes tractable in some restricted cases, which could be of interest to researchers working on algorithmic game theory.
4. cs.CC (Computational Complexity): The paper analyzes the computational complexity of the game and shows that it is NP-complete, which falls under the scope of computational complexity theory.
5. cs.CG (Computational Geometry): Although the paper does not explicitly deal with computational geometry, the game involves playing cards of different colors in increasing order, which could be seen as a geometric problem of arranging points on a line. Therefore, this sub-category could also be relevant.
